Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing with plenty of water and light.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water and looks unhealthy or wilting.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough light and looks unhealthy or pale.
The student can use their drawings to show that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can identify and illustrate patterns, such as differences in plant health with and without water and light.
